edu.ncsu.csc.Galant.gui.util

Class ExceptionDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc.Galant.gui.util.ExceptionDialog

  • public class ExceptionDialog
extends java.lang.Object

    Methods to support showing exceptions in dialog windows, so users using a GUI actually know they happened. (They call printStackTrace() as well as showing the exception in a dialog, so don't worry if you still want the exceptions printed to the console.) How to use:

    • In main, call setDialogExceptionHandlerAsDefault() so uncaught exceptions will appear in dialogs.
    • When you have to handle an exception that you don't expect to come up and don't know what do do with, call one of the displayExceptionInDialog methods instead of just saying something like e.printStackTrace();.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ExceptionDialog() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void displayExceptionInDialog(java.lang.Throwable e)
      Displays e in a dialog with an option to see its call stack.
      static void displayExceptionInDialog(java.lang.Throwable e, java.lang.Runnable onClose)
      Displays e in a dialog with an option to see its call stack.
      static void displayExceptionInDialog(java.lang.Throwable e, java.lang.String interpretation)
      Displays e in a dialog with an option to see its call stack.
      static void displayExceptionInDialog(java.lang.Throwable e, java.lang.String interpretation, java.lang.Runnable onClose)
      Displays an error message in a dialog with an option to see information about the Throwable that occured and the choice to either continue or quit the program, and calls Throwable.printStackTrace() on the Throwable.
      static java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler getDialogExceptionHandler()
      Returns an UncaughtExceptionHandler that displays uncaught exceptions in a dialog saying that "An unexpected exception occured."
      static void setDialogExceptionHandlerAsDefault()
      Sets the default uncaught exception handler to that returned by getDialogExceptionHandler().

        public ExceptionDialog()

    • Method Detail

      • displayExceptionInDialog

        public static void displayExceptionInDialog(java.lang.Throwable e)
        Displays e in a dialog with an option to see its call stack. Calls displayExceptionInDialog(Throwable, String) with null as the second argument.
        Parameters:
        e - the Exception to display.

      • displayExceptionInDialog

        public static void displayExceptionInDialog(java.lang.Throwable e,
                            java.lang.String interpretation)
        Displays e in a dialog with an option to see its call stack. Calls displayExceptionInDialog(Throwable, String, Runnable) with no Runnable.
        Parameters:
        e - the Exception to display.
        interpretation - a message to show the user. It can include html. (If it does, it must include the <html> tags.) If this is null, displays e.toString().

      • displayExceptionInDialog

        public static void displayExceptionInDialog(java.lang.Throwable e,
                            java.lang.Runnable onClose)
        Displays e in a dialog with an option to see its call stack. Calls displayExceptionInDialog(Throwable, String, Runnable), passing null as the second argument.
        Parameters:
        e - the Exception to display.
        onClose - a Runnable to run when the dialog is closed. If this is null, it is ignored.

      • displayExceptionInDialog

        public static void displayExceptionInDialog(java.lang.Throwable e,
                            java.lang.String interpretation,
                            java.lang.Runnable onClose)
        Displays an error message in a dialog with an option to see information about the Throwable that occured and the choice to either continue or quit the program, and calls Throwable.printStackTrace() on the Throwable.
        Parameters:
        e - the Throwable that occured. If this is null, does nothing.
        interpretation - a message to show the user. It can include html. (If it does, it must include the <html> tags.) If this is null, displays e.toString().
        onClose - a Runnable to run when the dialog is closed. If this is null, it is ignored.

      • getDialogExceptionHandler

        public static java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler getDialogExceptionHandler()
        Returns an UncaughtExceptionHandler that displays uncaught exceptions in a dialog saying that "An unexpected exception occured."
        Returns:
        an UncaughtExceptionHandler that uses dialogs.
        See Also:
        displayExceptionInDialog(Throwable, String)

      • setDialogExceptionHandlerAsDefault

        public static void setDialogExceptionHandlerAsDefault()
        Sets the default uncaught exception handler to that returned by getDialogExceptionHandler().
